intro: Vernonia cardenasii, commonly known as the Mexican ironweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is known for its tall, erect stems and clusters of small, purple or blue flowers. Vernonia cardenasii is often used in traditional medicine and has ornamental value due to its striking appearance. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining ecological balance in its native regions.
